verses.verse: The Lord<WH3068> spoke<WH1696> again to Moses<WH4872> and to Aaron,<WH175> saying<WH559> to them,

"Speak<WH1696> to the sons<WH1121> of Israel,<WH3478> saying,<WH559> 'These<WH2088> are the creatures<WH9130> which<WH834> you may eat<WH398> from all<WH3605> the animals<WH929> that are on the earth.<WH776>
'Whatever<WH3605> divides<WH6536> a hoof,<WH6541> thus making<WH8156> split<WH8156> hoofs,<WH6541> [and] chews<WH5927> the cud,<WH1625> among the animals,<WH929> that you may eat.<WH398>

'Nevertheless,<WH389> you are not to eat<WH398> of these,<WH2088> among those which chew<WH5927> the cud,<WH1625> or among those which divide<WH6536> the hoof:<WH6541> the camel,<WH1581> for though it chews<WH5927> cud,<WH1625> it does not divide<WH6536> the hoof,<WH6541> it is unclean<WH2931> to you.
'Likewise, the rock<WH9627> badger,<WH9627> for though it chews<WH5927> cud,<WH1625> it does not divide<WH6536> the hoof,<WH6541> it is unclean<WH2931> to you;
the rabbit<WH768> also, for though it chews<WH5927> cud,<WH1625> it does not divide<WH6536> the hoof,<WH6541> it is unclean<WH2931> to you;
and the pig,<WH2386> for though it divides<WH6536> the hoof,<WH6541> thus making<WH8156> a split<WH8156> hoof,<WH6541> it does not chew<WH1641> cud,<WH1625> it is unclean<WH2931> to you.
'You shall not eat<WH398> of their flesh<WH1320> nor<WH3808> touch<WH5060> their carcasses;<WH5038> they are unclean<WH2931> to you.

'These<WH2088> you may eat,<WH398> whatever<WH3605> <WH834> is in the water:<WH4325> all<WH3605> that have fins<WH5579> and scales,<WH7193> those in the water,<WH4325> in the seas<WH3220> or in the rivers,<WH5158> you may eat.<WH398>

'But whatever<WH3605> <WH834> is in the seas<WH3220> and in the rivers,<WH5158> that do not have<WH369> fins<WH5579> and scales<WH7193> among<WH4480> all<WH3605> the teeming<WH8318> life<WH8318> of the water,<WH4325> and among<WH4480> all<WH3605> the living<WH2416> creatures<WH5315> that are in the water,<WH4325> they are detestable<WH8263> things<WH8263> to you,
and they shall be abhorrent<WH8263> to you; you may not eat<WH398> of their flesh,<WH1320> and their carcasses<WH5038> you shall detest.<WH8262>
'Whatever<WH3605> <WH834> in the water<WH4325> does not have<WH369> fins<WH5579> and scales<WH7193> is abhorrent<WH8263> to you.

'These,<WH428> moreover, you shall detest<WH8262> among<WH4480> the birds;<WH5775> they are abhorrent,<WH8263> not to be eaten:<WH398> the eagle<WH5404> and the vulture<WH6538> and the buzzard,<WH5822>
and the kite<WH1676> and the falcon<WH344> in its kind,<WH4327>
every<WH3605> raven<WH6158> in its kind,<WH4327>
and the ostrich<WH3284> and the owl<WH8464> and the sea<WH7828> gull<WH7828> and the hawk<WH5322> in its kind,<WH4327>
and the little<WH9205> owl<WH9205> and the cormorant<WH7994> and the great<WH3244> owl,<WH3244>
and the white<WH8580> owl<WH8580> and the pelican<WH6893> and the carrion<WH7360> vulture,<WH7360>
and the stork,<WH2624> the heron<WH601> in its kinds,<WH4327> and the hoopoe,<WH1744> and the bat.<WH5847>
'All<WH3605> the winged<WH5775> insects<WH8318> that walk<WH1980> on [all] fours<WH702> are detestable<WH8263> to you.

'Yet<WH389> these<WH2088> you may eat<WH398> among<WH4480> all<WH3605> the winged<WH5775> insects<WH8318> which walk<WH1980> on [all] fours:<WH702> those which<WH834> have above<WH4480> <WH4605> their feet<WH7272> jointed legs<WH3767> with which<WH1992> to jump<WH9351> on the earth.<WH776>

'These<WH428> of them you may eat:<WH398> the locust<WH697> in its kinds,<WH4327> and the devastating<WH5556> locust<WH5556> in its kinds,<WH4327> and the cricket<WH2728> in its kinds,<WH4327> and the grasshopper<WH2284> in its kinds.<WH4327>
'But all<WH3605> other winged<WH5775> insects<WH8318> which<WH834> are four-footed are detestable<WH8263> to you.
'By these,<WH428> moreover, you will be made<WH2930> unclean:<WH2930> whoever<WH3605> touches<WH5060> their carcasses<WH5038> becomes<WH2930> unclean<WH2930> until<WH5704> evening,<WH6153>
and whoever<WH3605> picks<WH5375> up any<WH4480> of their carcasses<WH5038> shall wash<WH3526> his clothes<WH899> and be unclean<WH2930> until<WH5704> evening.<WH6153>

'Concerning all<WH3605> the animals<WH929> which<WH834> divide<WH6536> the hoof,<WH6541> but do not make<WH8156> a split<WH8156> [hoof], or which do not chew<WH5927> cud,<WH1625> they are unclean<WH2931> to you: whoever<WH3605> touches<WH5060> them becomes<WH2930> unclean.<WH2930>

'Also whatever<WH3605> walks<WH1980> on its paws,<WH3709> among all<WH3605> the creatures<WH9130> that walk<WH1980> on [all] fours,<WH702> are unclean<WH2931> to you; whoever<WH3605> touches<WH5060> their carcasses<WH5038> becomes<WH2930> unclean<WH2930> until<WH5704> evening,<WH6153>
and the one who picks<WH5375> up their carcasses<WH5038> shall wash<WH3526> his clothes<WH899> and be unclean<WH2930> until<WH5704> evening;<WH6153> they are unclean<WH2931> to you.

'Now these<WH2088> are to you the unclean<WH2931> among the swarming<WH8318> things<WH8318> which swarm<WH8317> on the earth:<WH776> the mole,<WH2467> and the mouse,<WH5909> and the great<WH9468> lizard<WH9468> in its kinds,<WH4327>
and the gecko,<WH604> and the crocodile,<WH9208> and the lizard,<WH3911> and the sand<WH2546> reptile,<WH2546> and the chameleon.<WH8580>

'These<WH428> are to you the unclean<WH2931> among all<WH3605> the swarming<WH8318> things;<WH8318> whoever<WH3605> touches<WH5060> them when they are dead<WH4194> becomes<WH2930> unclean<WH2930> until<WH5704> evening.<WH6153>

'Also anything<WH3605> on which<WH834> one of them may fall<WH5307> when they are dead,<WH4194> becomes<WH2930> unclean,<WH2930> including<WH4480> any<WH3605> wooden<WH6086> article,<WH3627> or<WH176> clothing,<WH899> or<WH176> a skin,<WH5785> or<WH176> a sack<WH8242> – any<WH3605> article<WH3627> of which<WH834> use<WH4399> is made<WH6213> – it shall be put<WH935> in the water<WH4325> and be unclean<WH2930> until<WH5704> evening,<WH6153> then it becomes<WH2891> clean.<WH2891>

'As for any<WH3605> earthenware<WH2789> vessel<WH3627> into which<WH834> one of them may fall,<WH5307> whatever<WH3605> <WH834> is in it becomes<WH2930> unclean<WH2930> and you shall break<WH7665> the vessel.

'Any<WH4480> <WH3605> of the food<WH400> which<WH834> may be eaten,<WH398> on which<WH834> water<WH4325> comes,<WH935> shall become<WH2930> unclean;<WH2930> and any<WH3605> liquid<WH4945> which<WH834> may be drunk<WH8354> in every<WH3605> vessel<WH3627> shall become<WH2930> unclean.<WH2930>

'Everything,<WH3605> moreover, on which<WH834> part of their carcass<WH5038> may fall<WH5307> becomes<WH2930> unclean;<WH2930> an oven<WH8574> or a stove<WH3600> shall be smashed;<WH5422> they are unclean<WH2931> and shall continue<WH1961> as unclean<WH2931> to you.
'Nevertheless<WH389> a spring<WH4599> or a cistern<WH953> collecting<WH9288> water<WH4325> shall be clean,<WH2889> though the one who touches<WH5060> their carcass<WH5038> shall be unclean.<WH2930>
'And if<WH3588> a part of their carcass<WH5038> falls<WH5307> on any<WH3605> seed<WH2233> for sowing<WH2221> which<WH834> is to be sown,<WH2232> it is clean.<WH2889>
'Though if<WH3588> water<WH4325> is put<WH5414> on the seed,<WH2233> and a part of their carcass<WH5038> falls<WH5307> on it, it is unclean<WH2931> to you.

'Also if<WH3588> one of the animals<WH929> dies<WH4191> which<WH834> you have for food,<WH402> the one who touches<WH5060> its carcass<WH5038> becomes<WH2930> unclean<WH2930> until<WH5704> evening.<WH6153>

'He too, who eats<WH398> some<WH4480> of its carcass<WH5038> shall wash<WH3526> his clothes<WH899> and be unclean<WH2930> until<WH5704> evening;<WH6153> and the one who picks<WH5375> up its carcass<WH5038> shall wash<WH3526> his clothes<WH899> and be unclean<WH2930> until<WH5704> evening.<WH6153>
'Now every<WH3605> swarming<WH8318> thing<WH8318> that swarms<WH8317> on the earth<WH776> is detestable,<WH8263> not to be eaten.<WH398>

'Whatever<WH3605> crawls<WH1980> on its belly,<WH1512> and whatever<WH3605> walks<WH1980> on [all] fours,<WH702> whatever<WH3605> has many<WH7235> feet,<WH7272> in respect to every<WH3605> swarming<WH8318> thing<WH8318> that swarms<WH8317> on the earth,<WH776> you shall not eat<WH398> them, for they are detestable.<WH8263>

'Do not render<WH8262> yourselves<WH5315> detestable<WH8262> through any<WH3605> of the swarming<WH8318> things<WH8318> that swarm;<WH8317> and you shall not make<WH2930> yourselves unclean<WH2930> with them so that you become<WH2930> unclean.<WH2930>

'For I am the Lord<WH3068> your God.<WH430> Consecrate<WH6942> yourselves therefore, and be holy;<WH6918> for I am holy.<WH6918> And you shall not make<WH2930> yourselves<WH5315> unclean<WH2930> with any<WH3605> of the swarming<WH8318> things<WH8318> that swarm<WH7430> on the earth.<WH776>
'For I am the Lord,<WH3068> who brought<WH5927> you up from the land<WH776> of Egypt,<WH4714> to be your God;<WH430> thus you shall be holy<WH6918> for I am holy.<WH6918>' "

This<WH2088> is the law<WH8451> regarding the animal,<WH929> and the bird,<WH5775> and every<WH3605> living<WH2416> thing<WH2416> that moves<WH7430> in the waters,<WH4325> and everything<WH3605> that swarms<WH8317> on the earth,<WH776>

to make<WH914> a distinction<WH914> between<WH996> the unclean<WH2931> and the clean,<WH2889> and between<WH996> the edible<WH398> creature<WH9130> and the creature<WH9130> which<WH834> is not to be eaten.<WH398>
